item.title: How Prince Andrew’s arrest is more about the monarchy’s survival than morality
item.description: Britain appears to have taken a calculated gamble: law over legacy. The arrest of Andrew Mountbatten, stemming from allegations tied to the Epstein files, represents crisis management at a civilisational level

item.title: Chagos Islands: A strategic pivot in Indo-Pacific great power rivalry
item.description: The Chagos issue lies at the crossroads of decolonisation, great-power rivalry, nuclear concerns, and Indo-Pacific security. How the UK, US, Mauritius, India, and other regional actors navigate the transition will determine strategic stability in the Indian Ocean amid rising Chinese assertiveness

item.title: Why India must read Bangladesh crisis carefully
item.description: As India grows more prosperous and urban comfort becomes routine, crises beyond our borders risk being reduced to headlines and hashtags. Yet Bangladesh’s political upheaval is not a distant spectacle. It is a cautionary tale about radicalisation, institutional fragility and the illusion of stability — one India must read carefully

item.title: Khajuraho and beyond: Exploring Bundelkhand’s hidden heritage
item.description: This spring, go beyond Khajuraho’s famed temples to uncover the forts, shrines and forgotten legacies that quietly shape Bundelkhand’s enduring heritage

item.title: From AI data centres to your next smartphone: The memory bottleneck is everyone’s problem
item.description: The memory shortage risks becoming a broader supply-chain problem. Unlike the pandemic-era chip crunch, which was driven largely by logistics and temporary disruptions, today’s shortage stems from a structural reorientation of manufacturing
